learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate your understanding of effective collaborative approaches to the preparation of ensemble repertoire for performance at a postgraduate/professional level
Identify and overcome challenges in the preparation of individual parts in a manner that supports being an effective ensemble performer at a postgraduate/professional level
Demonstrate your awareness of professional expectations surrounding ensemble performance in varied contexts at a postgraduate/professional level

assessments.due_date:
24/02/2025 - 11/04/2025

Precise times of assessment activities will be communicated via Blackboard
assessments.category: Participation/ Student contribution, Performance, Practical/ Demonstration
assessments.task_description:
Students receive a report from the director of their ensemble on their participation and engagement with learning activities in the first half of the semester. Detailed information about the learning activities for each ensemble are available on Blackboard.


Students will receive an Interim assessment comprising 40% of the assessment for this course. Rubrics or marking criteria will be made available on Blackboard before the start of semester.

For UQ Chamber Singers and Stagecraft, this is provided by the ensemble leader no later than the end of Week 7. 

For UQ Symphony Orchestra, this assessment will be a practical audition (conducted in Week 1) comprised of selected excerpts from the repertoire to be performed. A report form will be provided to the student by the end of Week 2.

For UQ Wind Symphony, a practical audition (conducted in Week 1) comprised of selected excerpts from the repertoire to be performed. A report form will be provided to the student by the end of Week 2.

For Chamber Music, students must perform between 10-15 minutes of selected repertoire in week 7 in an open masterclass setting and receive a written report the following week.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Not a submissible item, assessment is performance based throughout the first half of semester.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.assessment_title: End of Semester Performance Report/Director's Report
assessments.due_date:
14/04/2025 - 30/05/2025

Precise times of assessment activities will be communicated via Blackboard
assessments.category: Participation/ Student contribution, Performance, Practical/ Demonstration
assessments.task_description:
At the completion of the activities for the semester a final report for UQSO, UQ Chamber Singers, UQWS members and those studying Stagecraft is provided by the Ensemble Director or UQ assessor.

At the completion of the semester a final performance report for Chamber Music is provided in response to a 15-20 min performance of selected repertoire. All students in the Chamber Music stream must attend this performance forum.

Any rubrics or marking criteria will be made available on Blackboard before the start of semester.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Not a submissible item, assessment is performance based throughout the second half of semester.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(24 Feb - 01 Jun)
learning_activities.topic:
Chamber Ensemble Tutorials

All student-led chamber music ensembles will receive 6 hours of tutorials from relevant performance staff, distributed regularly throughout the semester (with a minimum of 3 to be scheduled before the mid semester break). Dates and times for tutorials will be scheduled in consultation with the allocated ensemble tutor(s).


Tutors expect demonstrable progress between tutorials and for student ensemble leaders to maintain regular contact. Ensembles must rehearse regularly (multiple times per week) and group members should divide responsibility equitably for different undertakings to ensure the smooth functioning of the ensemble.(For example - librarian, room bookings, rehearsal set-up and tutorial organisation.)


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Chamber Ensemble Tutorials All student-led chamber music ensembles will receive 6 hours of tutorials from relevant performance staff, distributed regularly throughout the semester (with a minimum of 3 to be scheduled before the mid semester break). Tutors expect demonstrable progress between tutorials and for student ensemble leaders to maintain regular contact. Ensembles must rehearse regularly (multiple times per week) and group members should divide responsibility equitably for different undertakings to ensure the smooth functioning of the ensemble.(For example - librarian, room bookings, rehearsal set-up and tutorial organisation.)

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(24 Feb - 01 Jun)
learning_activities.topic:
UQ Wind Symphony Rehearsals and Performances

All students who successfully auditioned for this ensemble are expected to practice and prepare parts to a high level for rehearsals and performances. Students are expected to attend all rehearsals. In addition to the scheduled rehearsal time, Wind Symphony members are expected to assist with the setup and bump-out procedures each week as this builds industry practice knowledge in wind symphony functioning within the industry.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(24 Feb - 01 Jun)
learning_activities.topic:
Stagecraft

This component of the Ensemble Studies course is open only to vocal students with interest in developing their skills in the field of opera. In this part of the Ensembles Studies course, particular emphasis will be placed on a singer’s presentation, movement, and communication with an audience. This will enable participants in this course to do more than just sing; as opera combines music and theatre, opera singers combine their vocal and musical skill with convincing acting and movement ability in order to bring the work of librettists and composers to life.


All students in this activity are expected to attend regular timetabled weekly classes, any additional classes and activities that are scheduled in the lead-up to performances, and those performances. Dates and times for additional rehearsals and performances will be announced on Blackboard as the semester progresses.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(24 Feb - 01 Jun)
learning_activities.topic:
Private Practice

All streams of activity in this course require diligent individual practice and preparation (including non-teaching weeks). You may also wish to use some time in your lessons in Performance Studies (if you're taking the course this semester) to cover some repertoire in Ensemble Studies. This will be at the discretion of your principal tutor.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(24 Feb - 01 Jun)
learning_activities.topic:
UQ Symphony Orchestra Rehearsals and Performances

All students who successfully auditioned for this ensemble are expected to practice and prepare parts to a high level for rehearsals and performances. Students are expected to attend all rehearsals. In addition to the scheduled rehearsal time, Symphony Orchestra members are expected to assist with the setup and bump-out procedures each week as this builds industry practice knowledge in symphony functioning within the industry.


Please note there will be intensive activity focused in and around Project Week.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
